definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Deborah's horrific death was a rare tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉的惨死是个极端的悲剧。

sentences.english: The tragedy of love between Jia Baoyu and Lin Daiyu is a great interest to the lovers of "Hong Xue"(study of A Dream of Red Mansions).
sentences.chinese: 宝黛爱情悲剧是“红学”爱好者最为关注的一个问题。

sentences.english: He played the leading part of Othello in the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 他在悲剧中扮演主角奥赛罗。

sentences.english: Martin recollected his blank-verse tragedy, and sent it instead.
sentences.chinese: 马丁想起了他的素体诗悲剧，便把它寄去充数。
这幅梦幻般的照片下面掩盖着悲剧。

sentences.english: This was but the beginning of the tragedy of this pair of star-crossed lovers.
sentences.chinese: 这仅仅是这一对不幸的情人悲剧的开始。

sentences.english: "The Reeds"is obviously the epitome of this tragedy in which love succumbs to the feudal ethical code.
sentences.chinese: 《蒹葭》正是这种“爱”屈服于“礼”悲剧的缩影。

sentences.english: His house gor burned down but he soon got over the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 他家房子烧了，不过他很快就从这一悲剧中振作起来。

sentences.english: Reflective warriors have a tragic sensibility.
sentences.chinese: 会反思的战士有一种悲剧敏感性。

sentences.english: That is the human tragedy of it all.
sentences.chinese: 这就是电影所要体现的人性悲剧。

sentences.english: Such is Golding's sense of human condition.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都是戈尔丁对人类境况的悲剧性意识。

sentences.english: Eagleton's view of tragedy secondly illustrates in his description of the tragic hero.
sentences.chinese: 伊格尔顿的悲剧观其次表现在他对悲剧人物的阐述上。

sentences.english: Eagleton's view of tragedy secondly illustrates in his description of the tragic hero.
sentences.chinese: 伊格尔顿的悲剧观其次表现在他对悲剧人物的阐述上。

sentences.english: When tragedy strikes, Mandira is devastated and they split.
sentences.chinese: 当悲剧罢工，曼德拉就是他们分裂和破坏。

sentences.english: JiangYu know all the culprit is the father CuiZhong tragedy of pain unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 江宇晓得一切悲剧的元凶是父亲崔钟达后痛苦不已。

sentences.english: The afternoon could have ended in mere tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午本应仅以一场悲剧就此结束。

definition: to recur (of events, esp. adverse ones)/to repeat (a performance)
